column1: Finally! https://t.co/rlwZ7SOcyz
I left parts of my body in Iraq where I was fighting terrorists. I don't need to justify myself to anyone.  https://t.co/B2D5JWVXyS
Any trial that doesn’t include witness testimony is a sham. https://t.co/6Ap00QGhLr

When it comes to the situation in Iran our leadership needs to do a lot less chest-thumping and instead focus more on diplomacy. Thanks @AC360 for having me on the show last night. https://t.co/vMhDDnGgOj

By taking out Soleimani Trump has not only put American lives in danger — he has also handed the Iranian regime nearly everything they wanted. Trump’s incompetence may very well pull us into war with Iran. Watch my interview with @maddow to learn more:   https://t.co/UCJHaj4dMe

Taking away food stamps from people who aren’t working without addressing the reasons why they aren’t able to work (mental health disability transportation child care etc.) isn’t just ineffective. It’s also cruel.   https://t.co/0womNJEoKU
Good order and discipline is the soul of our military and President Trump’s interference in the case of Chief Petty Officer Ed Gallagher threatens that foundation.    https://t.co/GNeqmzVoGW
Laws like this aren’t meant to protect women. They’re meant to shame them.   https://t.co/l8xQqQktKP

With everything going on in the world today it is important to remember that the opioid crisis continues to tear apart communities across our country.  This article gives a heartbreaking look at how one community has been affected:   https://t.co/TMG72w2JFE
78 years ago today we lost more than 2400 Americans in the attack on Pearl Harbor. Today let’s give thanks for those who served that day and the sacrifices they made to protect our country.

I am deeply saddened by Wednesday’s shooting at Pearl Harbor Naval Shipyard and this morning’s shooting at Pensacola Naval Air Station. Keeping the victims their loved ones and their communities in my thoughts today.
An important story. Both in Chicago and across the nation we must do more to make our public transportation accessible.  https://t.co/VSDRv4yo5w

My friend and fellow Illinois Senator @DickDurbin is filing paperwork today to officially kick off his reelection campaign. Let’s help his campaign get off to a strong start!   Chip in to help Dick Durbin kick off his reelection campaign!   https://t.co/dhZaY4k9pw

Our country should keep the promises it makes to our servicemembers. I'm fighting to ensure noncitizen Veterans who have been deported receive the respect they deserve and the benefits they've earned. Read my op-ed for @MilitaryTimes: https://t.co/ZcfCyTjoJJ
I spent Veteran’s Day in Tijuana meeting with Veterans who have been deported despite honorably serving our country. Thank you @11thHour for sharing their stories. https://t.co/TPpgMMHWvO
We must always remain vigilant in protecting our water. Check out my op-ed in the @ChicagoTribune about why we should strengthen the Clean Water Act. https://t.co/KCUaOnaCbh

A wonderful cause — this #VeteransDay I urge all American communities to reflect on how we can give veterans in need a helping hand. From one veteran to another thank you all for your service.  https://t.co/Kz59BhiBru
Chicagoans know who the real embarrassment to our nation is.  https://t.co/ICNxdtacCk
After all who would want to partner with us if they know that one phone call could persuade us to sell them out to their enemies?  Read more in my recent op-ed:   https://t.co/PJW1v2uRS4
Thanks for the great discussion @ValerieJarrett. Glad I could join you at the #DNC Women's Leadership Forum. https://t.co/pv8VIwadcs

I was so grateful for the opportunity to attend the #DNC Women's Leadership Forum yesterday. Women candidates across the country made history in 2018 and we'll do the same in 2020! https://t.co/Sqh9xG0NcC

Today our nation lost a true leader in Congressman Elijah Cummings. He will always be remembered as a passionate advocate for justice and equality. Our democracy is stronger because of him. #RIPElijah
“Rape is not a punishment for getting drunk.”  Thank you for speaking up Chanel Miller. Your brave words are making a difference. #KnowMyName https://t.co/XvJ2jRPBKW

Donald Trump’s administration violated that law and it is the House of Representatives’ constitutional responsibility to investigate and get to the bottom of why this whistleblower report was covered up by the Trump Administration. (2/2)
The whistleblower complaint should have been turned over to Congress. That’s the law. (1/2)
Only Congress has the power to declare war. Period.  https://t.co/ATpjmBzGyu
For Veterans who are in crisis visit https://t.co/ST3BQOzz77 or 800-273-8255 and press 1. (2/2)
This #SuicidePrevention Awareness Month it’s important to #BeThere for our fellow Americans who are struggling. If you or someone you know is in crisis call 800-273-8255. (1/2)

Welcome back @KatyTurNBC! Thank you for sharing this important story. It’s shameful Congress hasn’t voted on paid family leave. I’d love to see McConnell or anyone in GOP leadership explain their way out of that one on your show. https://t.co/yd6fkMomyn
We can’t afford to go backwards.  https://t.co/iEZvG1otRI
It’s past time for pharmaceutical companies to take responsibility for their role in spawning the opioid epidemic.   https://t.co/yauJo4ig9k
This is child abuse. Shame on this administration. https://t.co/hRjHtEgong
Spot on @LightfootForChi. https://t.co/ZyKMH6ADVc
@votevets @KamalaHarris @PeteButtigieg @JulianCastro @TulsiGabbard @NHDems So happy Vote Vets is hosting this important forum.
My heart goes out to everyone affected by Hurricane #Dorian. Learn more about how you can help relief efforts here:   https://t.co/OMlVG36oIn

The Trump Administration is once again trying to change our definition of who qualifies as an American.  Forcing these servicemembers and government employees to pay an application fee and jump through bureaucratic hoops is disgraceful. https://t.co/X0VTH5hhD6
I’m proud of my F rating from the NRA and I’m happy to see more and more members of Congress standing up to protect our communities from gun violence.  https://t.co/jPB2nvninO

Today is #BlackWomensEqualPayDay -- meaning that on average it takes African-American women all of 2018 *and* until today in 2019 to catch up to what white men made last year.   Learn more: https://t.co/DMBAFlMDPm
Thank you @todayshow for having me on and airing this important story. Let’s pass the #SchoolBusSafetyAct to make sure our children are safe on their way to school. https://t.co/Ps9ZyZBZk0
Couldn’t agree more @alexisohanian: “We need a federal bill that mandates quality paid family leave for everyone — birth parents adoptive parents and caregivers alike.” https://t.co/tzwSfT3DmA
Don’t look away. We must stop putting families in cages.  https://t.co/u9KlsAgv4d
ICYMI: All baseball fans should be able to enjoy America’s favorite pastime safely. That’s why @dickdurbin and I are asking @MLB to collect and report data on fan injuries.   https://t.co/7MQ2gBm6wr
Give me a break 🙄-- this is NOT who we are.  https://t.co/hRGpvceBbB
Thanks to @tammybaldwin for the Wisconsin cheese! https://t.co/JwPUH0gKrg
The Trump Admin announced they will start deporting the undocumented family members of troops who are currently deployed. I went on with @LesterHoltNBC to share my thoughts:   https://t.co/Hh5jYEXjFX

The gunman at the Gilroy Garlic Festival wasn’t able to buy an assault rifle in California...so he went next door to Nevada. We will only end the scourge of gun violence in this country if we pass nationwide legislation to ban assault weapons.  https://t.co/p6rRyRLDvK

It’s hard to think of a single reason why one small town would need more than 150 addictive pain pills per resident. It’s past time we hold drug companies responsible for creating this crisis.   https://t.co/jMxZ82yzKX

Before the #ADA was passed 29 years ago losing my legs could have meant losing my ability to have a job or a life outside my home. My life was made possible by those brave Americans who crawled up the steps of the Capitol in 1990. #ADA29

“I say that the promise of our country is for everyone to find success pursue happiness and live lives of equality. This is the Pueblo way. It’s the American way.”  Thank you @Deb4CongressNM for your brave and insightful words.   https://t.co/xBs3pfJ3Gz
Shame on you @ILGOP.   https://t.co/sMGe1lY1g7

All Veterans are entitled to the benefits and care they’ve earned no matter their sexual orientation or gender identity. Learn more about my work on the LGBT VA Advocacy Inclusion Act here:  https://t.co/3mbc5r3hIa
Couldn’t agree more. https://t.co/L19vGBLdOm
The U.S. Women’s National Team represents the very best of America -- “We saw women who are unapologetic for taking space and celebrating their victories.” 🙌⚽🏆  https://t.co/UNR35NrfWB
We will fight for however long it takes no matter how many times the Trump Administration tries to get this question on the #census.   https://t.co/feCd3vpz2y

We need diversity in elected office from municipalities and school boards all the way up to the White House – and that must include people with #disabilities. Thank you @NCILAdvocacy for your hard work to help disabled candidates break new ground.  https://t.co/j2tglkoOnC
That’s why I’m joining forces with 7 of my Senate colleagues to demand that McDonald’s require ALL their franchises to adopt their new sexual harassment policies.   https://t.co/jgZ9TIs8pp
If @McDonalds can tell their franchises how many pickles to put on a hamburger I would think they’d have the authority to tell them not to allow sexual harassment...
You can learn more about the #RationChallenge here: https://t.co/EKnWJr49bz

On #WorldRefugeeDay I’m thinking of the remarkable courage & perseverance displayed by tens of millions of refugees all over the world. They fled danger at home to find shelter + safety for their families. Learn more about the hunger they face with the #RationChallenge #WRD2019
Fascinating retrospective from the @chicagotribune  on Illinois the 19th Amendment and the long struggle to give women the right to vote:  https://t.co/udBxh9GdrN

Congratulations @ALISTROKER! But REALLY no ramp to allow her to get onstage?? 🤦‍♀️ I look forward to seeing more from Ali and to seeing a new generation of performers with disabilities take center stage! 🎤♿️🎭 https://t.co/rjTRMo3BpD
Wishing you all a Happy #PrideMonth from me and my entire team! I hope everyone celebrates in whatever way is most meaningful to you. https://t.co/ccCkrxxlry
Will taking soccer practice and English classes away from kids really Make America Great? These are children for God's sake. Stop this.  https://t.co/XBHKtt7mWi
In one interview #CadetBoneSpurs came up with excuses for his draft dodging AND defended his #transban which excludes people braver than him who VOLUNTEER to serve. Shameful.

I don't care if you were a "fan" of the Vietnam War @realDonaldTrump. I care that you used your money and privilege to get out of serving your country 5 TIMES while others volunteered to serve or were drafted and didn't have a choice.   https://t.co/gGatwgcQb6
Yesterday I brought my 4-year-old daughter Abigail with me to the Capitol so I could cast a vote. She complained "It's too noisy! Too many men!" I couldn't agree more!😂

The Mueller report revealed Russians hacked into Illinois’s election database. We have another election next year but not nearly enough has been done to prevent this from happening again. We must pass the PAVE Act to help ensure free and fair elections.  https://t.co/ah6R97fRir
This Asian-American and Pacific Islander Heritage Month I joined a group of fellow #AAPI women in Congress to share advice for the next generation of leaders. Thanks @bustle!  https://t.co/rJVoOEGc0t
Our country’s work in Iraq is far from finished. ISIS remains a serious threat. Check out my op-ed in @SJRbreaking:  https://t.co/G3esScTf0I
What a powerful video. All working parents -- including professional athletes -- deserve paid family leave.  https://t.co/98xZMrDYOD
ICYMI: I had an op-ed in the @latimes this Mother’s Day about how electing more women to Congress will help us *finally* pass working family legislation. Check it out:  https://t.co/LO9cPMVKwA

This isn’t “just” an environmental issue. It’s a matter of health and safety. It’s a matter of systemic racism and of discrimination against those in poorer neighborhoods.  It’s a matter of justice.  https://t.co/duK4Ow5SLP
Why are Republicans so dead-set on taking away access to affordable health care? Enough with the partisan games. Let’s work together to strengthen the ACA! (h/t @axios) https://t.co/Kh1ke37KoZ

Thanks again to PBS @NewsHour for having me on to talk about the ongoing battle against sexual assault in the military. We have to create a culture where survivors feel comfortable reporting what happened and confident that justice will be served. https://t.co/B1Qe9Im9AP
I’d always thought he was more Biggest Loser than Apprentice and now we have evidence of it...  https://t.co/CUzzcBI1Ch
Nope.  https://t.co/h4a8QNruoO

Last week I led a bipartisan congressional delegation to Iraq. It was my first time back since my Blackhawk was shot down 15 years ago. Once as a Soldier and now as a Senator it has always been an honor to serve. https://t.co/iiiWXY5Svi
ICYMI -- the Supreme Court will decide whether LGBT Americans are protected from employment discrimination under federal law. I hope they come down on the side of justice. https://t.co/HPyN6V8GqS

There’s an old saying “If you’re not part of the solution you’re part of the problem.” Well that’s especially true when it comes to protecting our environment and communities. That’s why I launched the Senate Environmental Justice Caucus. Learn more:  https://t.co/5u0QiRtA6K
Saddle up Texas! My friend @MJHegar is running for Senate. 🤠 https://t.co/QDoVTDDZs4

I’m proud that the bipartisan resolution I introduced to recognize the importance of vaccines passed the Senate. This is an important first step but we’ve still got work to do. https://t.co/hvRaLGt5zE
Throwback to when Maile first joined me on the Senate floor one year ago today! #FBF https://t.co/nj7GPYsvaQ

Last week I introduced legislation to protect military families from lead poisoning. It is a disgrace that any family connected to our Armed Forces -- or really any family in America -- has to worry that their tap water is making their kids sick. https://t.co/6IoOQtNFvH

President Trump’s #TransMilitaryBan went into effect last week. All this policy does is turn away good people who are willing to sacrifice for their country. It’s both discriminatory and foolish. #SupportTransTroops  https://t.co/0yCCQcPWW0
Goodbye and good riddance! https://t.co/HJ4wShHpds
Every airline passenger deserves to be treated with dignity and respect. INCLUDING passengers with disabilities. https://t.co/zSZAmmoR4v  (3/3) #DisabilityRights

I know firsthand that when an airline damages a wheelchair it is more than a simple inconvenience — it's a complete loss of mobility and independence. It’s the equivalent of taking my legs away from me again. (2/3)

Thanks to a law I wrote and got passed DOT released info on how many wheelchairs airlines damage monthly. We should be able to find out if airlines have high rates of breaking wheelchairs just like we can find out if they have high rates of flight delays or cancellations. (1/3)

My friend Lori Lightfoot made history this week by getting elected the first Black woman - and first openly gay - mayor of Chicago. Sign our card to say a big CONGRATS! https://t.co/l2SHLqLd65 https://t.co/AIc0pe1knb

So excited to have written the foreword for the new book #WhyIRun. It was edited by @kchildsgraham and includes essays by 35 progressive politicians who are changing politics. Part of the proceeds go to @runforsomething. Read it and run! https://t.co/bPDxnO59Ck https://t.co/dpOHqYTiMJ
Happy Valentine's Day from the Tammys 💞 https://t.co/rZY9UXKOlL

Today I participated in the Rockford Ministers Fellowship community celebration honoring Dr. King. The fight for equality still continues to this day. As we remember the legacy of Dr. King we must redouble our efforts to achieve his vision for social justice and equal rights. https://t.co/Yffas4XwW1
